[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Train Reservation Management System (TRMS) defines requirements for managing train reservations, schedules, and station operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: TRMS supports train reservations, cancellations, train schedules, station management, and customer data tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: TRMS integrates with station databases, city transit systems, and reservation platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: TRMS allows customers to book and cancel reservations, and administrators to manage train schedules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: TRMS supports kiosks, ticket printers, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: TRMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0 for authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: TRMS secures data via TLS encryption and user role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: TRMS is optimized for real-time ticket reservations and schedule updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: TRMS manages reservations, cancellations, train statuses, and station schedules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: TRMS is configurable for different train companies and station layouts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: TRMS connects with customer support, city transit maps, and financial services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: TRMS handles reservations, schedules, and station data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: TRMS is designed for train passengers, reservation agents, and railway operators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: TRMS relies on accurate train schedules, station records, and customer information.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: TRMS supports only one train per reservation.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Station: Train departure and arrival point.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage train schedules, including arrival and departure times (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall process customer reservations and cancellations (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow customers to book, modify, and cancel reservations (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage train details, including schedules, stops, and stations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store customer details, including name, contact information, and reservation history (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for booking, modifying, and canceling reservations.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store train schedules, including arrival and departure times.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store customer reservation records.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process ticket transactions within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with railway safety and ticketing regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for trains, stations, and reservations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for transaction tracking and compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests train schedules, reservations, and cancellations.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and railway compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Railway operation standards, ticketing policies, and customer service guidelines.
